articles.author: Web Webster
articles.description:
OpenTofu is an open-source alternative to Terraform’s widely used Infrastructure as Code provisioning tool. Previously named OpenTF, OpenTofu is an open and community-driven response to Terraform’s recently announced license change from a Mozilla Public License v2.0 (MPLv2) to a Business Source License v1.1, providing everyone with a reliable, open-source alternative under a neutral governance model.
The post OpenTofu: Open-Source Alternative to Terraform appeared first on Linux Today.
articles.title: OpenTofu: Open-Source Alternative to Terraform

articles.author: Web Webster
articles.description:
BookStack is a self-hosted, open-source, and easy-to-use platform for organizing and storing information. It can be used for various purposes, such as a wiki, documentation website, and note-taking application, to name a few. In this tutorial, you will learn how to install BookStack on a Rocky Linux 8-based server.
The post How to Install BookStack on Rocky Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
articles.title: How to Install BookStack on Rocky Linux

After only twelve maintenance updates, the Linux 6.7 kernel series is now marked as EOL (End of Life), which means that it will no longer receive bug and security fixes. Users who use Linux kernel 6.7 are now urged to upgrade to Linux kernel 6.8 releases.
The post Linux Kernel 6.7 Reaches End of Life, Users Urged to Upgrade to Linux Kernel 6.8 appeared first on Linux Today.
